name: Poco Diablo Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for one night whilst touring Grand Canyon area. As we were part of an organised tour, we seemed to be allocated the cheapest rooms in this beautiful resort - fairly dark with little natural light - lots of the rooms had balconies over-looking the beautiful grounds - would have made a huge difference to the whole experience.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting, beautiful grounds, average room

reviews.text: The room was however spotlessly clean, with very comfortable beds and plenty of towels and coffee making facilities.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay in Sedona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had an evening meal, which was very good and a buffet breakfast, which was a little on the cold side and with limited choices.
reviews.title: Wedding trip to Sedona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, no major complaint, simply would have preferred a room with more natural light and/or nice view.
reviews.title: Left in middle of the night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were also very helpful and pleasant.
reviews.title: Magical Anniversary Stay

reviews.text: on past reviews I've admitted to being a hotel snob but once I got past what seemed like a refreshed motor lodge this was actually a very nice stay. The rooms are much more modern and upgraded than the exterior would suggest. Decent pool and jacuzzi (great after a day hiking the red rocks). Really good location too. They have sleep number beds - not a fan. 9 hole par 3 golf course. Not sure how this is considered a resort but a very nice place for the price.
reviews.title: Old Outside, Upgraded Inside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed again at the Poco Diablo Resort this weekend. You can't find anything more beautiful....out the back of our room was the golf course/gazebo/pond.....it was breath taking. The beds are Sleep Number, which is of course, a plus. Then the bathrooms look like they've just been remodeled.....even down to the soap and towels they use....it's TOTALLY first class. i am in awe of this magnificent place. It is the best secret in Sedona and for the best price. Check it out.....you will not be disappointed!!!!
reviews.title: My All Time Favorite Sedona Resort!

reviews.text: For the price, this was a great place. The staff was friendly and helpful. Especially the staff in the restaurant! Room was nice. Sleep number bed was great!
reviews.title: Staff was great!

reviews.text: I stayed for 5 nights while attending a Road Scholar program. The Poco Diablo Resort is a beautiful, large and well-maintained property and the staff is very helpful and friendly. The program paid for the standard room, but I upgraded to a Poco King (room 627) which had a fireplace, jacuzzi, balcony, sitting area and view of the golf course and red hills. The upgrade was $20. per night over the standard room and well worth it.
reviews.title: Good Choice for a comfortable Stay near Central Sedona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very comfortable with nice amenities and good linens and towels. There is a mini- refrigerator, separate sink apart from the main bathroom and a large closet. There is no in-room safe.
reviews.title: Room lovely - bed not so lovely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From check in we were treated like VIPs. We were introduced to Gene the concierge who did his best to help us with a last minute 4x4 rental. Our room was spacious, comfortable and exceptionally clean. The public areas in the hotel were all well maintained, and very welcoming. The golf course and garden areas are beautiful, and provide a peaceful and relaxing vista whilst you enjoy a pre dinner drink. All in all a fantastic resort - I wish we could have stayed longer. We'll definitely be back!
reviews.title: Great resort - great hospitality

reviews.text: our stay at the Poco Diablo in sedona Az., in our Comfortable, well appointed room,startd off with an upgrade, stroll through their golf course. Staff were extremely helpfull, friendly and went beyond customer service..
reviews.title: excellant

reviews.text: I live in Phoenix and travel often for work to Sedona. Poca Diablo Resort is where I stay. It is always clean, comfortable and beautiful. The staff always goes above and beyond to make my stay warm and welcoming. I recommend to anyone to stay at Poca and enjoy all they have to offer and it's beautiful property. It is truly my home away from home! Renea Johnson-Weissman
reviews.title: My home away from home

reviews.text: What a lovely place to stay all the while enjoying the beauty of Sedona. Booked this at the last minute and it was all great. Rooms were lovely, pool and deck great, restaurant had good food and service... can't complain at all!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in beautiful Sedona

reviews.text: We got our reservation through an online discount site where you don't know the lodging until you agree to pay for the stay. I was convinced, based on the site's description, that we would be staying at another property.
reviews.title: A great find

reviews.text: I'll start with the good qualities of this resort. Check-in was prompt, and we received good service from the front desk staff, who gave us a sheet that listed some dining recommendations. (Please note that the place listed as "best" Mexican food is not actually good!) Also, the price of this room, when compared to some other places in Sedona was reasonable. If you like to golf, they have a gorgeous 9-hole course on property for less than $10. Parking was easily accessible, and wireless internet was free. I left something at the hotel, and the lost and found staff were quick to get back to me. These points are where the 3rd star came from, otherwise I would have given 2 stars.
reviews.title: Average, run-down, and dated hotel

reviews.text: The property itself is dated, and many facilities are in need of repair and/or redecorating. This struck me as more of a budget family resort. We noticed there were a lot of children there, which could be a plus for some travelers.
reviews.title: Not Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room that we were put in smelled musty and had poor lighting. The bathroom was below average, and the tub was not very clean. (It had mildew around the edges.) The shower curtain smelled as well. The "sleep number" beds were not working. My friend and I called to ask about a wine opener, and were told we could come get one. I was surprised they hadn't offered to deliver it to our room. We would have gladly tipped whoever had come. The pool area was run-down, and the hot tub was very chipped so that it hurt to sit on the sharp edged seats that were made of concrete that had been eroded.
reviews.title: Our Two Night Stay at Poco Diablo in beautiful Sedona

reviews.text: Overall I do not recommend this resort. Besides the friendly service, it is not special at all, and even the low relative cost compared to other Sedona resorts does not justify its shortcomings.
reviews.title: Comfortable and nicely renovated

reviews.text: I went to a work function and brought my family to enjoy the weekend. I picked the Poco because I thought it would have more to offer than the hotel the rest of my co-workers were staying at. For nearly double the price, I was not impressed.
reviews.title: great resort!

description: Centrally located among Sedona's lush landscaping and Red Rock views, Poco Diablo Resort offers affordable hotel accommodations and onsite resort amenities including an outdoor heated swimming pool, 4 professional USTA approved lighted tennis courts, a 9-hole family friendly golf course and fully equipped fitness center. Guests will also enjoy guest rooms featuring premium BeautyRest Beds, Free Wi-Fi, T. Carl's onsite restaurant and our 10th Hole Lounge with stunning views of our golf course, Massage Services available on site.
